newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish KPW to discuss new bourse requirements Aug.
newsitem.headline: Polish KPW to discuss new bourse requirements Aug.

text.p: The Polish Securities Commission (KPW) expects to approve the bourse's new capital-requirement rules in August, a KPW deputy head told daily Parkiet in its Tuesday edition.
"I think the document should be approved by us in August," Zofia Bielecka was quoted as saying, referring to the bourse's new rules.
The bourse seeks to increase by 50 percent capital requirements for companies seeking a listing on its main and parallel markets.
The new requirements would not apply to the exchange's third or so-called free market, where no stocks currently trade, and to companies already listed.
Under the present rules the market value of shares approved for bourse trade and the net asset value of a company seeking a main market listing have to be at least 24 million zlotys.
Companies seeking a parallel market listing have to meet a 12-million-zloty threshold.
The minimum capital requirement for third floor trading is four million zlotys.
The bourse has said the new requirements could come into force as soon as September.
